What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.

Comments_List: Ability to speak Spanish in the past tense. Ability to read Spanish novels. Conversational skills improved.
Spanish vocabulary, verb tenses and sentence construction
Basic Spanish skills
I learned a great basis of Spanish grammar, vocab, and culture.
This class covered a lot of important elementary grammar and vocal skills in the Spanish Language. I learned how to say a lot of basic things in spanish with very basic constructions.
I learned the basics of Spanish including the present, preterite, and present progressive tenses for verbs, as well as vocabulary.
Spanish
I began to develop a conversational fluency for spanish.
I learned really useful and important information on the basic grammar and structure of the spanish language.
I learned a ton. We learn how to speak, write, read, and understand basic Spanish.
Thought the course was structured well.
SuperSite homework becomes a bit monotonous but overall the work is pretty manageable. Exams are fair, nothing is too terribly difficult.

The course is really great in that the homework is not super time consuming but is consistent and previews what will be taught in class. I think the only thing that could be improved is having more in-class preparation for oral and audio exams.

I enjoyed the vocal practice and grammar constructions we learned. I think that covering the grammar in a more organized way would help with memorization and retainment of the different types of contructions.
The course is rather fast paced -- more review of subjects learned could help, for example making the homework about the previous lesson rather than the next.
Needs more Spanish speaking and interaction in class. Would like it if the instructor spoke more Spanish and less in English. Textbook sucks and Course packet sucks
The daily homework was very tedious at times. The daily homework was also extensive at times.

It was a very good class. I had an amazing professor and am sad to see her leave. The class could be improved by having more practice with audio comprehension and with practice grammar worksheets rather than reviewing the textbook grammar that we read for class. Doing the practice in class would allow us to ask questions in the moment.
Yes. Katie Brown was an excellent instructor.
Yes, Spanish is a worldwide language and the course is pretty well taught.
Yes! I learned so much and it was actually quite fun. However, I think the course depends mostly on the professor and who your classmates are.
I would. This is a good introductory course for any who has had spanish or is learning spanish as a new language.
Yes
Yes, but also Spanish classes in high school are better
Yes, if you want to learn Spanish. Having never taken Spanish before, it does take a lot of time.
Yes, it's a very useful course it one wants to begin learning spanish.
Yes. Take Spanish.
